quotes.quote: We have too many high sounding words, and too few actions that correspond with them.
quotes.author: Abigail Adams

quotes.quote: I've arrived at this outermost edge of my life by my own actions. Where I am is thoroughly unacceptable. Therefore, I must stop doing what I've been doing.
quotes.author: Alice Koller

quotes.quote: All human actions have one or more of these seven causes: chance, nature, compulsion, habit, reason, passion, and desire.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Men acquire a particular quality by constantly acting a particular way... you become just by performing just actions, temperate by performing temperate actions, brave by performing brave actions.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Actions lie louder than words.
quotes.author: Carolyn Wells

quotes.quote: Deliberation is the function of the many; action is the function of one.
quotes.author: Charles de Gaulle

quotes.quote: The superior man is modest in his speech, but exceeds in his actions.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: You cannot have a proud and chivalrous spirit if your conduct is mean and paltry; for whatever a man's actions are, such must be his spirit.
quotes.author: Demosthenes

quotes.quote: I have long since come to believe that people never mean half of what they say, and that it is best to disregard their talk and judge only their actions.
quotes.author: Dorothy Day

quotes.quote: An event had happened, upon which it is difficult to speak, and impossible to be silent.
quotes.author: Edmund Burke

quotes.quote: Action is character.
quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quotes.quote: You ask me why I do not write something....I think one's feelings waste themselves in words, they ought all to be distilled into actions and into actions which bring results.
quotes.author: Florence Nightingale

quotes.quote: In this theater of man's life, it is reserved only for God and for angels to be lookers-on.
quotes.author: Georges Clemenceau

quotes.quote: Happiness lies not in the mere possession of money. It lies in the joy of achievement, in the thrill of creative effort.
quotes.author: Herbert Hoover

quotes.quote: When a man asks himself what is meant by action he proves he is not a man of action. Action is a lack of balance. In order to act you must be somewhat insane. A reasonably sensible man is satisfied with thinking.
quotes.author: Jean Paul Richter

quotes.quote: Somewhere deep down we know that in the final analysis we do decide things and that even our decisions to let someone else decide are really our decisions, however pusillanimous.
quotes.author: John Locke

quotes.quote: Words without actions are the assassins of idealism.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Only actions give life strength; only moderation gives it a charm.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: I have always thought the actions of men the best interpreters of their thoughts.
quotes.author: Samuel Butler

quotes.quote: I was seldom able to see an opportunity until it had ceased to be one.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: We defend and we build a way of life, not for America alone, but for all mankind.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Don't be too timid and squeamish about your actions. All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Life is one long process of getting tired.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: Nothing will ever be attempted if all possible objections must be first overcome.
Aggressive fighting for the right is the greatest sport in the world.

We are face to face with our destiny and we must meet it with high and resolute courage. For us is the life of action, of strenuous performance of duty; let us live in the harness, striving mightily; let us rather run the risk of wearing out than rusting out.
Delay is preferable to error.
